question.text: Liver is the largest gland and is associated with various functions, choose one which is not correct?

options.text: Secretion of a hormone called enterogastrone

solution.text: The liver is the largest gland in the human body. It performs a variety of functions like it stores excess glucose in the form of glycogen and thus helps in the metabolism of carbohydrates. It helps in the digestion and emulsification of fats. It produces the digestive juice bile, which helps in digestion of fats and gives the characteristic color to stool and urine. Gastrin is not secreted by the liver. It is a gastrointestinal hormone secreted by the parietal cells of the stomach.
